title: Build executor
description: Builds an image using instructions from the Dockerfile and a specified build context directory.

add-hosts.description: List of customs host-to-IP mapping (e.g., docker:10.180.0.1)

allow.description: List of extra privileged entitlement (eg. network.host,security.insecure)

build-contexts.description: List of additional build contexts (e.g., name=path)

cache-from.description: List of external cache sources for buildx (eg. user/app:cache, type=local,src=path/to/dir)

cache-to.description: List of cache export destinations for buildx (eg. user/app:cache, type=local,dest=path/to/dir)

cgroup-parent.description: Optional parent cgroup for the container used in the build

context.description: Build's context is the set of files located in the specified PATH or URL (default .)

labels.description: List of metadata for an image

load.description: Load is a shorthand for --output=type=docker (default false)

network.description: Set the networking mode for the RUN instructions during build

no-cache.description: Do not use cache when building the image (default false)

platforms.description: List of target platforms for build

provenance.description: Change or disable provenance attestations for the build result

pull.description: Always attempt to pull a newer version of the image (default false)

push.description: Push is a shorthand for --output=type=registry (default false)

registries.description: Container registries to deploy built images to

secrets.description: List of secrets to expose to the build (eg. key=string, GIT_AUTH_TOKEN=mytoken, NPM_TOKEN=${NPM_TOKEN})

secret-files.description: List of secret files to expose to the build (eg. key=filename, MY_SECRET=./secret.txt)

ssh.description: List of SSH agent socket or keys to expose to the build

target.description: Sets the target stage to build

images.description: List of Docker images to use as base name for tags. Required.

tags.description: List of tags as key-value pair attributes

sep-tags.description: Separator to use for tags output (default '\n')

sep-labels.description: Separator to use for labels output (default '\n')
